news.title: 特朗普前顾问：格陵兰将保持格陵兰
news.title0: Greenland 'will stay Greenland', former Trump adviser declares
news.content: 特朗普前经济顾问称，美国无法强迫格陵兰易主，并暗示总统的言论可能是谈判策略。
news.content0: Donald Trump will not be able to force Greenland to change ownership, a former top adviser to the US president has told the BBC.IBM's vice chairman Gary Cohn, who advised Trump on the economy in his first term, said "Greenland will stay Greenland" and linked the need for access to critical minerals to his former boss's plans for the territory.Separately, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent urged people to "relax" and "let things play out" on the tariff threats against Europe over Greenland.Speaking at a news conference at the World Economic Forum in Davos, Bessent compared the reaction to Trump's announcement on US tariffs last year and claimed the current situation was different.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 布鲁克林·贝克汉姆公开与父母决裂
news.title0: I don't want to reconcile with family, says Brooklyn Peltz Beckham
news.content: 贝克汉姆长子公开表示不愿与父母和解，并指责父母试图破坏他的婚姻。
news.content0: Brooklyn Peltz Beckham has said he does not want to "reconcile" with his family - in his first public comments addressing reports about his relationship with his parents.In a series of posts on Instagram, the eldest child of Sir David Beckham and Lady Beckham accused his parents of "attacking" him and his wife in the press, saying they tried "endlessly to ruin"his relationship with Nicola Peltz Beckham.After months of speculation about a feud in the high-profile family, hesaid he had tried to keep the situation private but was left with "no choice but to speak for myself and tell the truth".The BBC has contacted Sir David's and Lady Beckham's representatives for comment. The pair have never acknowledged the rift.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 英国海滩被泄漏薯条和洋葱覆盖
news.title0: Volunteers clear washed-up bags of chips from beach
news.content: 英国苏塞克斯郡海滩因货船集装箱泄漏，被数千袋薯条和洋葱覆盖，志愿者展开清理。
news.content0: Volunteers have been working to remove thousands of bags of chips which washed ashore on a beach in Sussex.The clear-up operation was launched amid concerns over the potential impact of the debris on wildlife.The chips washed up near Eastbourne afterseveral shipping containers with "food and packaging" were found to have came ashore on Tuesday.Eastbourne Borough Council (EBC) said on Monday that the plastic had "largely been removed by volunteers".
news.author: BBC

news.title: 加拿大女子在澳大利亚海滩遭野狗围尸
news.title0: Canadian woman found dead surrounded by dingoes on Australian beach
news.content: 一名19岁加拿大女子在澳大利亚昆士兰州海滩被发现死亡，尸体被一群野狗包围。
news.content0: A 19-year-old Canadian woman has been found dead, with her body surrounded by a pack of dingoes on a popular Australian beach, according to local officials.The body of the tourist, whose name has not been released, was found around 06:30 local time on Monday (20:30 GMT on Sunday) on the beach on K'Gari, an island off Australia's eastern coast, Queensland police said in a news release.Two men driving along the beach spotted a pack of about10 dingoes around an object, which they realised was a woman's body, police inspector Paul Algie told local media.Police are investigating the incident, but cannot yet confirm whether she died from drowning or from being attacked by the animals, he said.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 澳大利亚48小时内发生四起鲨鱼袭人事件
news.title0: Surfer injured in fourth shark attack in Australian state in 48 hours
news.content: 澳大利亚新南威尔士州海岸48小时内发生四起鲨鱼袭击事件，一名冲浪者受伤，多片海滩关闭。
news.content0: A surfer has been bitten by a shark, the fourth attack along Australia's New South Wales (NSW) coastline in under 48 hours.The 39-year-old man "sustained a wound to his chest" after a shark bit his board on the Mid North Coast on Tuesday morning, police said. He has been released from hospital.It follows three other attacks in Sydney over the past two days. All beaches in Sydney's northern area will remain closed until further notice, said police.The attacks follow days of heavy rains, which NSW Superintendent Joseph McNulty had earlier said may have created a "perfect storm environment" for shark attacks. Rain flushes nutrients into the water, which can draw sharks closer to shore.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 巴勒斯坦儿童足球场面临以色列强拆
news.title0: Palestinian children's football pitch faces Israeli demolition ultimatum
news.content: 约旦河西岸一处巴勒斯坦儿童足球俱乐部面临以色列当局的强拆令，引发国际关注。
news.content0: A Palestinian children's football club in the occupied West Bank faces imminent demolition despite an international campaign to save it. Its supporters say it provides a rare sporting opportunity for young Palestinian players.But Israel insists it's been built without the necessary permits.In this deeply divided land so much is contested; from the identities and faiths of the people who live here, to every inch of the ground they stand on.Recently, that has come to include one small patch of artificial turf laid down under the shadow of the giant concrete wall that isolates Israel from much of the occupied West Bank.
news.author: BBC

news.title: 米兰男装周：奥运热与“宿敌”首秀
news.title0: A ‘Heated Rivalry’ runway debut and Olympics fever at Milan Men’s Fashion Week
news.content: 米兰男装周充满奥运氛围，拉夫·劳伦举办专场秀，Dsquared2迎来热门剧集明星走秀。
news.content0: The skies may have clouded over during the Fall-Winter 2026 season of Milan Men’s Fashion Week, but for many in the city, spirits were high – lifted by excitement surrounding the Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games taking place this year in Milan and Cortina.
news.author: CNN

news.title: 印尼发现失踪监视飞机残骸
news.title0: Indonesia finds wreckage of missing surveillance plane carrying 10
news.content: 印尼当局在雾中山坡上找到失踪的渔业监视飞机残骸，机上10人中已发现一具遗体。
news.content0: Indonesian authorities said on Sunday they had located the wreckage of a fisheries surveillance plane that went missing inSouth Sulawesi provinceon the slope of a fog-covered mountain and had recovered the body of one of the 10 people on board.
news.author: CNN

news.title: 马莎百货技术主管在遭网络攻击后离职
news.title0: M&S technology chief quits less than a year after cyber attack
news.content: 英国马莎百货首席技术官在公司遭遇严重网络攻击后不到一年宣布离职。
news.content0: Another of Marks & Spencer's (M&S) most senior technology executives is leaving the company less than a year after its operations were devastated by a cyber attack.
news.author: Sky News
